definition: imperial censor (formal title of a dynastic official)
to resist/imperial/(classical) to drive (a chariot)/to manage/to govern
history/annals/title of an official historian in ancient China

sentences.english: The procuratorial system of our country is originated from the system of imperial history in ancient times.
sentences.chinese: 我国检察制度渊源于古代御史制度。

sentences.english: The birds do not fly ape real, bluish white South Qin shi.
sentences.chinese: 飞鸟不飞猿不动，青骢御史上南秦。

sentences.english: Take this pile of money and print the Lotus Sutra for these friends and relatives?
sentences.chinese: 她把御史叫来“用这笔钱给亲友们印法华经。”

sentences.english: However, the authority of imperial officials brings forth large negative impact.
sentences.chinese: 但是，御史的权威也产生了极大的消极影响。

sentences.english: Yuan and the beginning of worship to monitor the censor, sitting framed Li Jifu, the prefectural governor for the information.
sentences.chinese: 元和初，拜监察御史，坐诬李吉甫，出为资州刺史。

definition: to accuse/to impeach/(in imperial China) to level charges against an official
to accuse of misconduct (in official task)/to impeach
inspector-general of province in Ming and Qing times
Minister of Revenue (from the Han dynasty onwards)
prefectural magistrate (during Tang to Qing times)

senior provincial government official in dynastic China
